status.description: Rocky Linux 9 Blueprint that uses AHV IPAM (DHCP) or for VMware requests IPv4 from the user and ejects CDROM. Sends out an email notification on successful creation of VM.

action_list.description: System action for creating an application
action_list.name: action_create

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    EjectCdrom
# description:  ejects all cdrom devices (/dev/sr*).               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

for device in /dev/sr*
do 
    sudo eject $device
    echo "Ejected ${device}"
done

#!/bin/bash # region headers # * author: stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com # * version: v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version # task_name: SendMail # description: sends an email notification to the Calm user including vm details. # output vars: none # dependencies: none # endregion sudo sed -i 's/MaxSessions 1/MaxSessions 10/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo sed -i 's/#Subsystem/Subsystem/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo /bin/systemctl restart sshd.service From=@@{email_sender}@@ To=@@{requester_email}@@ Subject="Your VM @@{vm_name}@@ is ready!" Body="

Hello @@{vm_requester_name}@@,

You had requested a Linux VM, we have successfully deployed your instance and you can start using it using the following information...

Service type: Linux instance
Machine IP address: @@{address}@@
Instance name: @@{vm_name}@@
Login: @@{sshuser_username}@@
Password: none: using your private ssh key

For security reasons, please do not share your password or key with anyone.

Regards,

The Cloud Team

" echo " import email.message import smtplib server = smtplib.SMTP("\"@@{smtp_server}@@\"", 25) msg = email.message.Message() msg['Subject'] = "\"${Subject}\"" msg['From'] = "\"${From}\"" msg['To'] = "\"${To}\"" html_content="\"${Body}\"" msg.add_header('Content-Type', 'text/html') msg.set_payload(html_content) server.sendmail(msg['From'], [msg['To']], msg.as_string())" | tee ~/send_notification echo "Sending user notification" python ~/send_notification rm ~/send_notification

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y

cloud_init.user_data:
#cloud-config
disable_root: false
ssh_pwauth:   true
hostname: @@{vm_name}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@

users:
  - name: @@{LINUX_ROOT.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ROOT.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{LINUX_ADMIN.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ADMIN.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{sshuser_username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
    - @@{sshuser_sshkey}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    
runcmd:
  - [sudo, systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]

guest_customization.cloud_init:
#cloud-config
disable_root: false
ssh_pwauth:   true
disable_network_activation: true
hostname: @@{vm_name}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@
network:
  config: disabled
users:
  - name: @@{LINUX_ROOT.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ROOT.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{LINUX_ADMIN.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ADMIN.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{sshuser_username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
    - @@{sshuser_sshkey}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
write_files:
  - path: /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0
    content: |
      DEVICE=eth0
      BOOTPROTO=none
      ONBOOT=yes
      IPADDR=@@{vm_ip}@@
      NETMASK=@@{subnet_mask}@@
      GATEWAY=@@{gateway}@@
      DNS1=@@{dns1}@@
      DNS2=@@{dns2}@@
      DOMAIN=@@{domain}@@
runcmd:
  - [systemctl, restart, NetworkManager]
  - [systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    DisableSelinux
# description:  disables enforcement of selinux policy.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo hostnamectl set-hostname --static @@{vm_name}@@
echo "@@{address}@@  @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@ @@{vm_name}@@" | sudo tee -a /etc/hosts

#sudo /bin/systemctl stop firewalld || true
#sudo /bin/systemctl disable firewalld || true

sudo sed -i 's/SELINUX=enforcing/SELINUX=disabled/' /etc/selinux/config
sudo setenforce 0

# skip temporarily
exit 0
# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20221118 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    InstallPython
# description:  installs python and defines default version.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

sudo dnf install python39 -y
sudo alternatives --set python /usr/bin/python3.9
python --version

attrs.script:
#!/bin/bash

# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    EjectCdrom
# description:  ejects all cdrom devices (/dev/sr*).               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

for device in /dev/sr*
do 
    sudo eject $device
    echo "Ejected ${device}"
done

#!/bin/bash # region headers # * author: stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com # * version: v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version # task_name: SendMail # description: sends an email notification to the Calm user including vm details. # output vars: none # dependencies: none # endregion sudo sed -i 's/MaxSessions 1/MaxSessions 10/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo sed -i 's/#Subsystem/Subsystem/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config sudo /bin/systemctl restart sshd.service From=@@{email_sender}@@ To=@@{requester_email}@@ Subject="Your VM @@{vm_name}@@ is ready!" Body="

Hello @@{vm_requester_name}@@,

You had requested a Linux VM, we have successfully deployed your instance and you can start using it using the following information...

Service type: Linux instance
Machine IP address: @@{address}@@
Instance name: @@{vm_name}@@
Login: @@{sshuser_username}@@
Password: none: using your private ssh key

For security reasons, please do not share your password or key with anyone.

Regards,

The Cloud Team

" echo " import email.message import smtplib server = smtplib.SMTP("\"@@{smtp_server}@@\"", 25) msg = email.message.Message() msg['Subject'] = "\"${Subject}\"" msg['From'] = "\"${From}\"" msg['To'] = "\"${To}\"" html_content="\"${Body}\"" msg.add_header('Content-Type', 'text/html') msg.set_payload(html_content) server.sendmail(msg['From'], [msg['To']], msg.as_string())" | tee ~/send_notification echo "Sending user notification" python ~/send_notification rm ~/send_notification

attrs.script:
# region headers
# * author:     stephane.bourdeaud@nutanix.com
# * version:    v1.0/20210504 - cita-starter version
# task_name:    ApplyLinuxUpdates
# description:  applies updates and upgrades from default yum repo.               
# output vars:  none
# dependencies: none
# endregion

#this is required or update will fail on filesystem package
sudo umount /mnt

sudo yum update -y
sudo yum upgrade -y

cloud_init.user_data:
#cloud-config
disable_root: false
ssh_pwauth:   true
hostname: @@{vm_name}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@

users:
  - name: @@{LINUX_ROOT.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ROOT.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{LINUX_ADMIN.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ADMIN.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{sshuser_username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
    - @@{sshuser_sshkey}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    
runcmd:
  - [sudo, systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]

guest_customization.cloud_init:
#cloud-config
disable_root: false
ssh_pwauth:   true
disable_network_activation: true
hostname: @@{vm_name}@@
fqdn: @@{vm_name}@@.@@{domain}@@
network:
  config: disabled
users:
  - name: @@{LINUX_ROOT.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ROOT.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{LINUX_ADMIN.username}@@
    lock_passwd: false
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
    plain_text_passwd: '@@{LINUX_ADMIN.secret}@@'
  - name: @@{sshuser_username}@@
    ssh-authorized-keys:
    - @@{sshuser_sshkey}@@
    sudo: ['ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD:ALL']
write_files:
  - path: /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0
    content: |
      DEVICE=eth0
      BOOTPROTO=none
      ONBOOT=yes
      IPADDR=@@{vm_ip}@@
      NETMASK=@@{subnet_mask}@@
      GATEWAY=@@{gateway}@@
      DNS1=@@{dns1}@@
      DNS2=@@{dns2}@@
      DOMAIN=@@{domain}@@
runcmd:
  - [systemctl, restart, NetworkManager]
  - [systemctl, mask, cloud-init-local, cloud-init, cloud-config, cloud-final]
  - [eject]
